In spite of its toxic community and survivor sided balance, the game is a lot of fun. The ranking system could use some work and there's always perk balancing to be done, however the main foundation is solid and you can get a lot of time out of the game.

DO NOT PLAY ON AN ULTRA WIDE MONITOR! I play on a 3840x1080 monitor, and as a result, my POV is lessened and the game is stretched. Not worth it, and makes the game horrible to play. The game is meant for a 1920x1080 monitor, and if you're close to that, you'll probably be alright. If you have purchased the game or really want to even with the stretched monitor, look up how to play on a stretched res and you can make it look better, fixing your POV but it'll still look stretched.

And personally, I don't love the game itself, but I'm a bit biased due to the problems I had.

Pros :
- Fun to play with friends (as survivor)
- Release your will to kill people (as killer)
- Graphic is good
- Easy to learn, average to master
- Nice cosmetics
- a lot of perks and abilities so you can mix it up

Cons :
- toxic community
- face camping killer when you play solo as survivor is very annoying and make players got a tiny bloodweb
- grinding system (need 1 - 2k hours to get all perks and items)
- bugs (medium)
- a bit laggy sometimes (i have good connection)

Overall, I really recommend this game (8/10)

Llevo jugando alrededor de 60 horas y esas horas las obtuve jugando en 2 semanas, es juego muy divertido muy enganchante ya que cada partida siempre va a ser diferente y eso te a llevar a querer seguir jugando y jugando otra partida y eso provocara que le metas un vicio al juego.

Al principio se te va a dificultar sobrevivir contra los asesinos siendo superviviente ya que eres nuevo,pero conforme vallas jugando vas a ir agarrando practica en como saber esquivar al asesino y saber en que direcci√≥n debes de correr para que el asesino no te de un golpe y te deje tirado, conforme vallas jugando vas a ir conociendo todos los mapas y vas a ir viendo las estructuras en las cuales sepas que puedes darle vuelta tras vuelta al asesino(en alg√∫n momento te va a alcanzar debido a bloodlust que hace que caminen mas r√°pido los asesinos). si eres nuevo no te desanimes conforme juegues vas a ir aprendiendo a jugar, tambi√©n aprender√°s a pensar como asesino tratando de anticiparte a sus movimientos que el puede llegar a hacer para as√≠ evitar que te lleves un golpe.

Si juegas como asesino lo principal que debes de hacer es vigilar los generadores ya que son el objetivo de los supervivientes, si los vigilas vas a ir encontrando los supervivientes ya que en alguno estar√°n reparando, como asesino tienes que poner mucha atenci√≥n al sonido de todo el audio es tu mejor aliado como asesino para as√≠ encontrar a los supervivientes, en un comienzo se te dificultara golpear a los supervivientes ya que te van a empezar a dar giros y giros pero poco a poco tu te empezaras a anticipar a lo que van a hacer ellos y aprender√°s a pensar como superviviente.

Tanto como asesino o superviviente los tienes que ir subiendo de niveles, cada superviviente y asesino tienen habilidades unicas(a las habilidades se les conoce como perks) cuando llegues al nivel 40 de cada asesino o superviviente de va a permitir ense√±arle las habilidades √∫nicas de ese superviviente a cualquier otro superviviente al igual que en asesino, cuando llegas al nivel 50 puedes reiniciar ese asesino o superviviente y lo haces prestigio solo hay 3 niveles de prestigio.

El juego en si tiene muchos DLC¬¥s, te sugiero que los compres cuando esten en oferta ya que el precio que normalmente tiene es muy elevado.

!!QUE ESPERAS COMPRALO Y MATA A ESOS SUPERVIVIENTES!!


Bueno vuelvo a escribir aqui para actualizar la rese√±a le he dedicado mucho tiempo a este juego y se ha convertido en uno de mis favoritos sin duda alguna lo recomiendo mucho

Edit: llevo mas de 1000 horas en el juego y me sigue fascinando

This game is trash and I will never stop playing it.

I find that this game is a battle for morality now a days. After the last major patch which made a massive change to a majority of the maps, I have found myself dreading playing survivor, but I have no other choice because I want to play with my friends. It is infinitely easier to play killer and get points, but twice as hard to rank up. It is a dreadful slog to gain points as survivor and half of the time you don't get to play the full match, but yet still I've died almost 10 games in a row and pipped on every single one of them. Playing survivor could not feel more dissatisfying because every time I've been hit or been or hooked I cannot bring myself to think that it was my fault. In most chases I see one option for escape, either a pallet or window, and end up still getting hit through it anyway. I know that I lack the skill. I know it's my fault. But I can't learn a damn thing when I die in under 60 seconds! Yes, this has happened multiple times before. It occurred in the game I played before writing this in fact, which spawned the reason I'm writing this. I spawned in. Got shot by deathslinger. Found the one pallet that happened to spawn in the corner of the map I was in. Got shot through it and left to die. My friends got to play the rest of the match without me while I sat and watched in misery of my lack of understanding and skill. I don't remember paying over 20 dollars to watch others play the game. If there was something for survivors to do after death, I would not be writing this review negatively. It is the sole reason I hate playing survivor. The killer will always get to play the full game. The survivor won't. And survivor is 4 out of the 5 players in a match. So one player will always be satisfied (in most cases) and the other 4 won't be. In reference to the comment that started this post, this game has almost become a battle for whoever is the better person. The killer could kill me in under 60 seconds or let me go and play more of the match. But it is literally the objective of the game for the killer to kill me and by doing so, their job gets a lot easier. So why would they? Then in that last game I mentioned, another survivor told me I was utterly useless because I died so quickly... Yeah. What was I supposed to do. Rely on the ever elusive 4% chance to get off the hook by myself? NO. Because no killer respects that, no matter how much of a rarity or a meme it is. So yeah, I don't quite recommend the game in its current state. The game is not new player friendly because of its terrible ranking system. People who are at rank 1 can force themselves down the ladder back to where new players should be playing. So you get a mish mash of new players and experienced players trashing them and bullying them along the way. It is the most infuriating learning curve I've ever had to experience and it's not because of the game. It's because of the community. Oh and if you rank as a 15, you apparently get rank 4 and below because they queued with their low rank friends to abuse the system, but we don't mention that. 

However! (and yes there is a however) IF, they were to fix these ranking issues with players skill gaps (which they are doing as of me making this post) AND they were to make it so that survivors can actually experience the rest of the match in some way (look at white noise 2 for some ideas cause I think it would be a great addition), then other than that this game is great! It can be scary at times, plays fairly well when you're actually playing against people at your skill level, and is down right addicting. I might be complaining a lot in this review, but there is a reason I have a thousand plus hours. The game isn't bad. The experience is. Even playing as killer can be the most frustrating thing on the planet because some survivors know the game better than you. The reason is because the game in itself does not feel fair and rely's on the players to "play fair". What do I mean? Well take the earlier rant for example. I had gotten downed in under 30 seconds roughly (yes I actually managed to keep track because it was that quick) and the killer hooked me. I DID almost get saved, but the killer was keeping a very close eye on me. He wasn't "playing fair" even though there is no rule or boundary preventing him from doing this. I didn't get to play the game because of another players actions and choices, NOT because of the game. 

So in summary, just wait till the developers come out with an update to fix this gap in player skill level. I doubt they'll ever put in a system for survivors to do anything after death other than watch, but I can hope. They'll probably never read this review either to be honest. But the community and play styles of other players is the main reason this game suffers. Certain strategies like camping or slugging or tunneling don't feel fair to the survivor, but they are usable strategies that rarely punish the killer. I got a 4k insidious camping as Bubba at red ranks to test my theory, if you want proof. On my first try as well! But the game isn't bad in any respect. I love the 4v1 struggle between ordinary people and some juiced up killer from another dimension. The game holds it well. But damn if I don't want to uninstall the game every time I go down from something like tunneling or camping. It's not fun. Looping has been fixed to a degree. Might still need some work. But now it's time we move on to the survivors. They are four fifths of the game. But overall, buy this game if you're interested. Give it a try, I don't actually want to discourage you from giving this game a good run. Just be aware that there are some problems and people who will make you want to scream. Just try to spread some positivity around the community to help beat this issue. Anyway, to any of you who do decide to purchase this game, I'll see you in the fog. ;)

Fun game at first but then you start to see that the game is very VERY inconsistent with its balancing. They'll post an update about how they nerf an already nerfed killer but then buff a buff killer the same patch.

Running the game on a high end PC is also a joke. They lock you at 60 frames so that players do not have a 'competitive' advantage...what? is that a joke? They also LOCK vsync (ON) and there is NO WAY IN THE SETTINGS IN GAME TO CHANGE IT! You'll have to change the settings in the config files, once done you'll then find that you are BENT OVER by randomly being disconnected from games due to you fucking with their game files...this is a dev team that I would not buy another game from.

Update: Having over 1400+ hrs in this game, I would like to say this game has had its ups and downs. That being said, I still find this game quite enjoyable, and with the release of the new killer Dredge, I am having a lot of fun being scared of lockers! I can't wait to see what else is to come, killer and survivor-wise!

S'il √©tait besoin de le rappeler, le titre propose un gameplay asym√©trique permettant d'incarner, au choix, un tueur surpuissant, assoiff√© de massacre, mais seul ou un survivant fr√™le, d√©sireux de fuir, mais pouvant compter sur ses trois co-√©quipiers pour esp√©rer l'emporter.
